message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a learning framework for text classification, which falls under the natural language processing (NLP) domain. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of a selector and classifier, which are machine learning techniques, indicating that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of data aggregation to improve the robustness of the classifier, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also deals with text classification, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR), indicating that it could belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper mentions the use of real-world data, which could indicate that it could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) if the text classification task involves image captioning or other visual tasks.
